title: Ohtani's walk-off pushes Dodgers to historic 8-0

title: India imposes 'uniquely burdensome' certification requirements: White House
content: India’s duplicative testing and certification requirements in sectors such as chemicals, telecom products, and medical devices that make it difficult or costly for American companies to sell their products in India, the White House has said.

title: India should use the ‘window of opportunity’ to finalise a ‘stronger’  FTA with Sri Lanka, says economist
content: The proposed FTA could ‘cover services; allow freer movement of some classes of workers and overcome protectionist blockages in both countries — which are, I think, more on the Sri Lankan side,’ the economist said, adding that closer relationship between the two neighbours ‘should not upset other powers — China and the U.S. — which have stakes in Sri Lanka.’

title: No violence reported in Manipur in past four months, Ministry to convene a meeting of both communities soon, says Amit Shah in Lok Sabha

title: Donald Trump announces 26% ‘discounted reciprocal tariff’ on India
content: As he announced the tariffs, the U.S. President held up a chart that indicated that India charged 52% tariffs “including currency manipulation and trade barriers,” and America would now charge India a “discounted reciprocal tariff” of 26%

content: President Donald Trump on Wednesday announced huge new tariffs of 34 percent on imports from China and 20 percent on imports from the European Union -- two of the main US trade partners.

content: Parliament Updates: The Waqf (Amendment) Bill, 2025 was cleared with a majority in the Lok Sabha late on Wednesday, after an over 12-hour debate.

content: ‘No destruction, no cutting trees’, said the Acting CJ towards the end of post-lunch session, adjourning the matter to Thursday for continued hearing

content: Congress MP Gogoi says the government has four goals — ‘to dilute the Constitution, defame minorities, divide the Indian society and disenfranchise the minority communities’

title: Karnataka govt proposes a peripheral tunnel road connecting various national highways coming into Bengaluru
content: The project is among the 12 proposed by the State government for which approval was sought during Siddaramaiah’s meeting with Gadkari

title: "Pure White": Astronaut Reveals What Antarctica Looks Like From Polar Orbit
content: The captivating footage was taken through the Dragon's Cupola, a unique, all-glass dome on SpaceX's Crew Dragon spacecraft, offering astronauts stunning 360-degree views of space and Earth.

title: Karnataka Man Kills Wife, Children. Then Dies By Suicide
content: A man in Karnataka allegedly killed his wife, two children, then died by suicide, police said. The incident took place in a private apartment on Jewargi Road in Karnataka's Kalaburagi district.

title: NBA Power Rankings: What to watch for all 30 teams as season's end nears
content: teams are snapping up postseason spots but the race to avoid the play-in tournament is changing by the day . at the bottom end of the standings, several teams are straddling the fine line between a strong finish and improving their lottery chances for the no. 1 draft pick .

title: Explained: India likely to gain as Trump tariff shake-up hits China hard
content: President Trump’s new tariff plan includes a 10% universal tariff on imports, followed by country-specific tariffs. China faces the highest tariffs, up to 54%. India’s textile, electronics, and machinery sectors may benefit from competitive advantages. However, to capitalize on these opportunities, India must address structural issues and enhance manufacturing capabilities.

title: Watch: PM greeted with ‘Modi, Modi’ chants as he arrives in Thailand
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived in Thailand for a two-day visit to participate in the sixth BIMSTEC summit. Modi will engage in discussions with Thai PM Paetongtarn Shinawatra and join BIMSTEC leaders in signing the Agreement on Maritime Cooperation. The visit also includes meetings with key regional leaders and will be followed by Modi's visit to Sri Lanka.

title: Virat Kohli fans attack Bollywood star during RCB vs GT - here's why
content: A mix-up on social media led Virat Kohli's fans to mistakenly target Bollywood actor Arshad Warsi's Instagram with hate messages after GT bowler Arshad Khan dismissed Kohli for seven runs in an IPL match. RCB lost the game by eight wickets as GT, bolstered by Mohammed Siraj's bowling and Jos Buttler's half-century, secured the win.

title: Infosys files fresh charges against Cognizant in the US court; says…
content: Infosys has filed fresh charges against Cognizant in a US court, accusing it of anti-competitive practices to maintain dominance in the healthcare software market. The legal battle, which began with Cognizant's allegations of trade secret theft, has now intensified with claims of monopolistic behavior and obstruction of fair competition.

title: Trump reciprocal tariffs: Why India’s agri exports likely to be little affected
content: India's agricultural exports to the US may remain strong despite increased reciprocal tariffs by the Trump administration. With comparative advantages over competitors like China, Vietnam, and Thailand, Indian products like seafood and rice are expected to maintain demand.

title: LinkedIn co-founder to employees: Go home, have dinner with family
content: LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman revealed that in its early days, employees were expected to continue working from home after dinner with their families. Hoffman's stance signifies a demanding culture deemed essential for startup success and believes it drives significant financial rewards for those who embrace it.

title: IPL 2025: Big boost for LSG ahead of MI clash in Lucknow
content: Lucknow Super Giants received a boost with pacer Akash Deep joining ahead of their IPL match against Mumbai Indians. After recovering from a back injury, Akash Deep is now fit and set to enhance LSG's bowling lineup. He bolsters the team amidst injuries to players like Mayank Yadav and Mohsin Khan, making this crucial for LSG's playoff hopes.

title: 'Typical bullying practice': China's sharp response to Trump's tariffs move
content: China expressed strong opposition to the new US tariffs, which include a 10 percent base tariff on global imports and an additional 34 per cent targeting China. Beijing condemned the move as violating international trade norms, harming global economic development, and destabilising supply chains. The Chinese commerce ministry urged Washington to cancel the tariffs.

title: Melinda Gates shares the ‘scariest conversation’ on divorce she had with Bill Gates
content: Melinda French Gates shares insights into her decision to end her marriage to Bill Gates in her new memoir, revealing it was spurred by recurring nightmares and her husband's infidelity. She discusses the challenging divorce process and emphasizes the importance of staying true to oneself.

title: Diabetes, heart attack have this strange connection with your bedroom lighting
content: Sleeping with bright lights on can negatively impact blood sugar levels and cardiometabolic health, as found in a 2022 study. Researchers observed increased insulin resistance, higher heart rates, and decreased deep sleep in individuals exposed to light. Experts recommend a regular sleep routine, avoiding screens before bed, and maintaining a dark, cool, quiet sleep environment.

title: 'Bill now Rs 1cr': Husband dumps paralysed wife in hospital for 2 years
content: A housewife disabled from an accident has been abandoned at Apollo Multispeciality Hospitals for over two years. Her husband claims he is unable to care for her, and the outstanding hospital bill is Rs 1 crore. The court has directed the state counsel to suggest a remedy.

title: Myanmar earthquake death toll surpasses 3,000
content: The death toll from Myanmar's recent 7.7 magnitude earthquake has reached 3,085, with 341 people still missing and over 4,700 injured. The military junta has announced a temporary ceasefire to aid rescue operations, amidst ongoing efforts by international teams providing nearly 1,000 tonnes of relief supplies.

title: Scientists discover four Earth-like planets orbiting Barnard's Star
content: Scientists have discovered four new Earth-like rocky planets orbiting Barnard's Star, just six light-years away. Using advanced technology, these are the smallest exoplanets detected via the radial velocity method. Though too hot for life, their discovery aids in understanding planetary compositions and the potential for life in our galactic neighborhood.

title: Cheer on reciprocal tariffs! Trump spares India’s pharmaceutical industry
content: US President Trump has exempted Indian pharmaceuticals from new reciprocal tariffs, benefiting India's pharmaceutical sector. This sector is vital for affordable medicines and economic stability, with the US market representing 30% of Indian exports.

title: IPL match today: KKR vs SRH - all you need to know
content: Kolkata Knight Riders and Sunrisers Hyderabad find themselves at the bottom of the IPL 2025 points table. KKR's batting lineup is inconsistent, and SRH struggles in powerplays. The Eden Gardens pitch might favor spinners, with both teams looking to improve their standings.

title: Trump’s 26% 'discounted' tariff: Is Indian economy relatively insulated?
content: US President Donald Trump announced new reciprocal tariffs to counter high duties charged on US goods by foreign countries. With tariffs on countries like China, India, and the EU, the move aims to rebalance trade.

title: 'Great friend, but ...': What Trump said about PM Modi and India in tariff speech
content: US President Trump labeled Prime Minister Modi as his 'great friend' while announcing a 26% retaliatory tariff on India, addressing the trade imbalance and high Indian tariffs on US goods. Trump emphasized the need for negotiations to create a level playing field and highlighted the substantial US trade deficit with India.

title: Indian national sentenced to 35 years in US for sexual exploitation of minors
content: A 31-year-old Indian national in the US, Sai Kumar Kurremula, has been sentenced to 35 years for child exploitation and distributing child pornography. He manipulated children via social media and blackmailed them with inappropriate content when they did not comply with his demands. Kurremula admitted to exploiting three minors and was arrested following an FBI investigation.

title: IPL 2025: 'Surface' tension irks franchises
content: Franchises in the Indian Premier League have expressed dissatisfaction with pitch preparations not aligning with their strengths. The BCCI instructs curators to prepare balanced pitches, causing possible friction with teams desiring home advantages.

title: Jaiswal’s switch hit: From elite Mumbai to minnows Goa
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal has decided to transfer from Mumbai to Goa for the upcoming domestic season, highlighting his career aspirations and personal circumstances. His inclusion in the Goan squad is seen as a significant opportunity for local players to learn from a national team member.

title: Salman Khan’s lookalike held in Lucknow for making video with gun
content: Reportedly, Salman Khan’s lookalike, Aazam Ansari, has been arrested in Lucknow for blocking the road, arguing with people, and allegedly making a video with a gun. Ansari claimed he was unfairly detained while drinking tea. The police cited his expired gun license as a major concern and he alleges he was mistreated by police and faces difficulties obtaining bail.

title: Sensex tanks over 500 points as Trump imposes 26% reciprocal tariffs on India
content: Stock market today: BSE Sensex and Nifty50, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Thursday after US President Donald Trump announced 26% reciprocal tariffs on India. While BSE Sensex dipped over 500 points, Nifty50 was near 23,200.

title: ‘Sikandar’ day 4 box office: Salman-Rashmika film stays under Rs 10 crore
content: Salman Khan and Rashmika Mandanna's 'Sikandar' was released on March 30, 2025, and has accumulated ₹84.45 crore in four days. Despite its high initial expectations, the film received mixed reviews and witnessed a substantial post-Eid drop in earnings, recording a 50% decline on day 4.

title: Bengaluru CEO hospitalised as blood pressure hits 230, shares 'important learnings'
content: Amit Mishra, a Bengaluru-based entrepreneur, shared a frightening health scare on LinkedIn, with his blood pressure soaring to 230 and landing him in the ICU. His experience highlights the hidden dangers of modern work culture and underscores the importance of balancing work and health, emphasizing regular checkups and emergency preparedness.

title: Siraj gets emotional on Chinnaswamy return: 'I was here for seven years'
content: Mohammed Siraj reflects on his emotional return to M Chinnaswamy Stadium, now playing for Gujarat Titans against his former team, RCB. Siraj's impressive performance, claiming three wickets, earned him Player of the Match. He credits his success to the guidance of Ashish Nehra and Ishant Sharma, and fans, with his Ronaldo-inspired celebration.

title: IAF fighter jet crashes in Gujarat's Jamnagar, one pilot dead
content: A Jaguar fighter jet crashed near Jamnagar during a training mission, killing one pilot and injuring another. The incident caused a massive fire and panic among nearby villagers. Emergency teams responded quickly, and the injured pilot was taken to GG Hospital. The exact cause of the crash remains unknown.

title: 'Going to fight': How world leaders reacted to Trump's tariff move
content: President Donald Trump announced a 10% baseline tariff on all US imports, excluding Canada and Mexico, intensifying a trade war. World leaders, including those from Canada, Australia, Spain, Ireland, and Italy, expressed concerns and vowed countermeasures to protect their economies and workers while condemning the potential negative impacts of these tariffs.

title: KKR vs SRH: Focus on opening acts in replay of 2024 final
content: Defending champions Kolkata Knight Riders and Sunrisers Hyderabad are desperate to regain momentum with two losses each in their three respective matches so far in IPL 2025. Both teams need strong opening partnerships for success, considering their past performances as top Powerplay scorers in the last edition of the IPL.

title: The Warriors fan whose courtside looks turned into an NBA fashion brand
content: a woman was wearing a painted and bejeweled Warriors jacket in 2021 . her sister, Jodie, launched DannijoPro, a label of NBA apparel . payton's sister has made custom pieces for the warriors .

title: Canada and Mexico missing from Trump's reciprocal tariff list. Here's why
content: President Donald Trump announced new tariffs, imposing a 10% baseline tax on most imports, with increased rates for nations with trade surpluses. Notable exceptions include Canada and Mexico due to existing agreements. High tariffs target China, the EU, South Korea, Japan, and Taiwan, with a new 25% tariff on all foreign-made automobiles, sparking concerns of global retaliation.

title: Who is Zach Yadegari, the 18-year-old millionaire rejected by top universities?
content: Zach Yadegari, an 18-year-old entrepreneur earning $30 million annually from his AI startup, Cal AI, was rejected by elite universities like Harvard and MIT despite a 4.0 GPA. His admissions essay questioning the necessity of college education might have played a role. However, he was accepted into top schools like Georgia Institute of Technology and University of Miami.

title: Was engaged to provide CEEW services for USAID task: ASAR
content: ASAR Social Impact Advisors clarified that it received Rs 8 crore from USAID for services provided under a Clean Air Better Health project with CEEW. The company denied receiving any foreign direct investment and affirmed full compliance with legal requirements amid an ongoing investigation by authorities.

title: 'Friend is worst than foe': Full list of Trump’s reciprocal tariffs
content: US President Donald Trump announced significant tariffs on imports, including a 34% tax on Chinese goods and 20% on the European Union. The move, aimed at reducing trade deficits and bolstering American manufacturing, has sparked concerns about potential global trade wars and rising consumer prices. Several US allies are considering retaliatory measures, which could impact diplomatic relations.

title: Not powerless against mockery of anti-defection law, SC tells Telangana
content: Supreme Court reprimanded the Telangana CM and assembly speaker over alleged MLA defections. The court asserted its power to enforce the anti-defection law, especially when the speaker delays disqualification decisions. The bench highlighted its role as a constitutional protector and warned against making a mockery of the 10th Schedule.

title: Rally in Manipur against Myanmar border fence
content: Thousands protested in Ukhrul, Manipur against the Union government's decision to end the free movement regime (FMR) and build a barbed-wire fence along the India-Myanmar border. Tribal communities, like the Tangkhul Naga, voiced strong opposition, stressing that the move would sever familial ties and heighten tensions.

title: Average adoption waiting period climbs to 3.5 years
content: The adoption process in India remains lengthy, with an average wait time of three and a half years for infants. Despite the number of adoptions reaching over 4,500 in 2024-25, thousands of prospective parents continue to wait anxiously, with the demand for younger children far exceeding available orphans for adoption.

title: In Nepal's classrooms, youngsters wonder if republic has delivered
content: The 2001 Nepalese royal massacre resulted in the monarchy's end and a republic with frequent leadership changes. Rising disillusionment among the youth has led to a resurgence of pro-monarchy sentiments, driven by political instability and a lack of direction. Many students are calling for reliable governance.

title: SC: State can't decide on rural stints for doctors from outside
content: The Supreme Court criticized the Uttarakhand government's 2009 policy requiring non-state students in MBBS courses to serve in remote areas or pay Rs 30 lakh. The court emphasized that this policy should be a uniform decision by the Union government, citing challenges faced by students from other states in serving in inaccessible regions.

title: SC panel records top cop's statement on fire at judge's house
content: The Supreme Court commission investigating the March 14 fire at former Delhi High Court judge Yashwant Varma's residence has recorded statements from Delhi Police commissioner Sanjay Arora and other senior officers. Arora detailed that the storeroom with cash was kept locked and located near a CRPF guard room.

title: NMC reviews disability norms to focus on what candidates can do
content: The National Medical Commission is revising disability guidelines for medical course admissions to focus on candidates' performance abilities rather than disability percentages. This follows a Supreme Court directive and aims to outline essential medical competencies crucial for safe practice, provoking criticism over the composition of the reviewing committee.

title: SKY Breaks Silence After Report Claims He's Leading Coup Against Mumbai
content: a report claimed that there was a 'coup underway' in the Mumbai team . sources close to the left-hander have denied the development . the report also claimed that rumour mills suggest that he is playing the lead role .

title: Supreme Court Sacks 25,000 Teachers, Huge Blow To Mamata Banerjee Government
content: the supreme court has upheld the Calcutta High Court order . the decision is "vitiated by manipulation and fraud," the court said . it said the appointments resulted from cheating and are thus fraudulent .
